pros: -Great team of people -Interesting shows to potentially be able to see (depending what role you’re assigned to during the shift) -easy work, but always learning new things -fun and creative environment

job_title: Event Sales Coordinator in Calgary, AB
pros: Depending on the area you work you get to see a lot of shows for free in the Jack Singer Concert Hall and Engineered Air Theatre if you are not working them. There are many other companies in the Arts Commons building for you to enjoy other events and shows. The PT bar and usher staff are all very sweet and helpful. Great people to work with.
cons: It is a very clicky place, very two-faced, up in the office area. They expect you to understand everything very fast and throw it all at you right away. If you ask too many questions or the same question too many times, because you haven't done it a long time, they look at you very judgingly. All I can say is make sure you are always making good notes that can refer to all the times. When you have your weekly review don't be afraid to ask ... 'what can I do better next time?' Because they never indicate that there is ever an issue or a problem...not even when you are walking out the door. If you do something incorrectly they won't tell you how they wish things to be done. They just expect you to know. They don't communicate effectively and the old guard stick together, so it is very hard to be included in their culture. They start off very nice and helpful, but that changes over a short time and you don't know why. It just happens.

pros: its a nice place to work at
cons: The pay was little for the amount of work you had to do

pros: Very family and community driven arts facilities.
cons: Like all not-for-profits, chronically under staffed and fast paced work life
